Virella.Notes: Strict spiritual order, highly militarized channeler training

Sersai.Role: Home of the Arcanum of the Veil
Sersai.Notes: Espouses individual enlightenment through the Entity, in constant ideological conflict with Virella

Nuvia.Notes: Acts as neutral economic power, major trading hub

Dravon.Notes: Internal civil war, holds 4 council seats (2 each side)

Takkir.Notes: Strange culture, a splinter hive has formed a religious faction tied to the Entity

Dawnbound Creed.Belief: The Entity is divine structure, best used in unity and discipline

Arcanum of the Veil.Belief: The Entity is personal, mysterious, and best explored individually

Coalition of Three.Purpose: Mutual defense, economic unity, limiting religious war escalation

Zai'kir Cell.Belief: The Entity is a unifying psychic song

Age of Awakening.Event: First channelers appear; religious divisions form
Age of Awakening.Notable: Sixth planet destroyed by Arcanum mystic in final battle
Age of Awakening.Result: Both Orders scarred; limits of Entity-channelling realized

Entity Use.Rarity: Extremely rare, highly trained or chosen

Training Systems.Other Worlds: Some local traditions exist, mostly martial or espionage-based

Species_and_Sapient_Life.Humans: Most populous species; adaptable and politically diverse
Species_and_Sapient_Life.Giantfolk: Towering humanoids, live on surface of Dravon
Species_and_Sapient_Life.Delverkin: Subterranean humanoids with echo-based senses and culture
Species_and_Sapient_Life.Zai'kir: Insectoid species, hive-based with psionic queens
Species_and_Sapient_Life.Ratfolk: Scavenger-like, specialize in tech repair and salvage

Everyday_Life.Virella: Structured, militarized, spiritual pilgrimage sites common
Everyday_Life.Sersai: Dream temples, decentralized communes, shadow markets
Everyday_Life.Nuvia: Corporate megacities, cyber fashion, constant trade

Dravon.Delverkin: Underground cities, secrecy and stealth norms

Everyday_Life.Takkir: Hive cities, pheromonal communication zones, psychic relay towers

Spacestations: Relay Spires – Military & cargo stops between planets
Ghost Arcs – Abandoned or pirate-claimed trade hubs
Solar Netway – Dawnbound’s communication and energy web
The Spindle – Coalition HQ and diplomacy nexus

Mythic Heroes.Dawnbound: Eidon the Blazing, Entity-wielder who died ending the Age of Awakening
Mythic Heroes.Arcanum: Kelyx the Silent, whose dreamwalker spirit is said to still influence minds
Mythic Heroes.Zai'kir: Zithyr Queen Eternal, mythical Zai’kir that whispered the first command
Mythic Heroes.Dravon: Torrok & Sevrak, sibling warriors that split the planet in half
Mythic Heroes.Nuvia: The Gilded Trickster, founder of the first interplanetary black market

Living Legends.Takkir: Queen Ithara of the Broken Chorus

Major Flashpoints: Religious cold war between Dawnbound and Arcanum

Notable Groups.Ashen_Circle: Psychopathic rogue Channelers controlled by a manipulator known as The Shepherd
Notable Groups.Veilbreakers: Mysterious, unaffiliated Channeler-hunters feared across all planets
Notable Groups.Fangspire Company: Mercenary army led by Lucien Vale, unaffiliated but deeply influential

Stats.Creation_Cap: Stats may not start higher than 5 without special rules.

Health.Starting_Restriction: Characters start with 10 HP unless modified.
Health.At_0_HP: Character is incapacitated and vulnerable to lasting harm or death (GM discretion).

Initiative.Tiebreaker: Higher Willpower acts first → if still tied, re-roll.

Difficulty_To_Hit.Formula: 5 + target’s Level + gear/stat bonuses + situational modifiers

Damage_Types.Physical: Blunt, slash, pierce. May cause Bleeding.
Damage_Types.Elemental: Fire, cold, lightning, acid, sonic, etc.

Conditions.Stunned: Lose Action; -1 DTH until next turn.
Conditions.Restrained: Speed 0, disadvantage on Physical rolls, +1 to be hit in melee.
Conditions.Blinded: Disadvantage on attacks, attackers +1 to hit, auto-fail sight checks.

Afflicted.Description: Ongoing damage each round until cured.

Each_Round.3: Resolve ongoing effects at end of turn.

DM_Difficulty_Scaling: Raise enemy **Level** to increase DTH and save DCs.
Use terrain, cover, and conditions for variety instead of just higher numbers.

Racial_Traits: Recognized and respected across most interplanetary alliances
Naturally versatile - +1 to all mental checks
Affinity for secret paths and hidden knowledge - +1 to mental checks for finding hidden things and for technology checks
Resistant to cold and environmental hazards
Giantsized - +1 to all physical checks related to strength
Resistant to charm, fear, or domination effects - +1 to all checks against being panicked or stunned
Disliked by Humans, Delverkin, and Giantfolk
Natural resistance to toxins/disease - +1 to any saves against the corruption damage type
Can squeeze through tight spaces and evade grapples - +1 to physical checks to evade grapples and perform acrobatics

Brood-Shard.Description: Born from the collective consciousness of the Zai’kir hive, you are a rare individual permitted to act alone — a fragment with purpose. You may be driven by instinct, latent directive, or the terrifying freedom of independent thought.
Brood-Shard.Connection: Broodmother Vellix, a high-ranking hive node who still whispers to you across the psionic veil when danger nears.

Delverkin_Shadow_Broker.Description: Trained in secrecy beneath the surface cities of Sersai or Dravon, you operate in networks of trade, sabotage, and surveillance. To you, knowledge is currency.
Delverkin_Shadow_Broker.Connection: Echo-Three, a masked Delverkin informant who controls a private network of hidden data tunnels throughout the underground.

Dravonic_Warborn.Description: You were raised among towering mountains and ancestral battlefields where combat is language and legacy. Your hands know war better than peace.
Dravonic_Warborn.Connection: Warchief Ulgar Horncleaver*, your former mentor who leads a minor Giantfolk clan and honors blood debts — especially yours.

Dawnbound_Acolyte.Description: You were tutored by the Dawnbound Creed on Virella, taught to seek light in all things — even if others call it blind idealism. You believe truth shapes reality.
Dawnbound_Acolyte.Connection: Speaker Marrek Vos, a Dawnbound emissary with Coalition political clout who may protect or guide you in times of crisis.

Veil-Walker_Novitiate.Description: Prophecies shaped your youth, and your teachers at the Arcanum of the Veil taught you that destiny is not chosen — only interpreted. You see signs in silence.
Veil-Walker_Novitiate.Connection: Sister Naera, a cloaked mystic stationed in an embassy on Sersai who can offer cryptic insight and rare relics if approached properly.

Nuvian_Tech_Apostle.Description: You are a believer in circuitry, computation, and code. Whether raised on Nuvia itself or taught by a wandering tech-priest, you see inefficiency as sin.
Nuvian_Tech_Apostle.Connection: Module-47, a sentient AI assistant embedded in your toolkit — loyal, sarcastic, and connected to off-grid Coalition archives.

Coalition_Drifter.Description: You've never stayed anywhere long. You’ve run cargo, conned pirates, stowed away on pleasure liners, and lived by your instincts in lawless space.
Coalition_Drifter.Connection: Jexa “Ratwires” Vonn, a black market fence and smuggler captain who owes you two favors and hates saying no.

Novice_Mercenary.Description: You’ve recently taken up arms for credits — guarding caravans, hunting bounties, or pulling security work in sketchy zones. You’re rough around the edges but eager to prove yourself.
Novice_Mercenary.Connection: Sarn Drelko, a grizzled merc commander who once vouched for you and might do it again — if you haven’t embarrassed him too much.

The_Tempest_Warden.Channeler: Mael Veridun, Whisper of the Storm Veins
The_Tempest_Warden.Playstyle: Hyper-mobile controller/striker - creates momentum-based effects, suppresses enemy formations, calls down cosmic-scale storms

Level_1.Name: Stormsense
Level_1.Effect: You gain +1 DTH (Difficulty To Hit) against ranged attacks.
Level_1.Narrative: You anticipate incoming projectiles as air pressure bends toward impact. Your body moves just before the shot lands.

Level_2.Name: Volt Snap
Level_2.Effect: When you make any attack, you may deal 1 lightning damage to any one target within your attack's range as a free action.
Level_2.Narrative: Crackling arcs lash outward, tagging distant threats in tandem with your strike.

Level_3.Name: Gust Step
Level_3.Effect: Once per turn, you may take an additional fast dash, moving up to your full movement again without triggering opportunity attacks.
Level_3.Narrative: A cyclone gathers at your feet and launches you forward in a blur of wind and sparks.

Level_4.Name: Magnetic Pulse
Level_4.Effect: Once per scene, release a wave of force that pushes all creatures within 2 spaces back by 1 space. Enemies pushed into surfaces take bonus damage.
Level_4.Narrative: A low thrum erupts into a shockwave that clears your immediate area.

Level_5.Name: Skybreaker
Level_5.Effect: Once per scene, call down a lightning bolt from the sky that strikes a 2x2 zone for 5 lightning damage.
Level_5.Narrative: Clouds part with a deafening crack, and white-blue fury crashes down on your enemies.

Level_6.Name: Charge Sink
Level_6.Effect: When damaged by an energy or ranged attack, you may store that damage. On your next turn, add that amount as bonus lightning damage to your attack.
Level_6.Narrative: You absorb the hit with a flickering shimmer - and return it twice as loud.

Level_7.Name: EchoPulse
Level_7.Effect: You gain an innate sense of surrounding kinetic signatures. Permanently gain +2 DTH.
Level_7.Narrative: Even without sight or sound, you feel the shift of every heartbeat and footstep around you.

Level_8.Name: Cyclone Vault
Level_8.Effect: Once per long rest, create a spiraling cyclone that restrains up to 10 creatures within 3 spaces of you. Enemies must pass your Save DC each turn or remain restrained, up to 10 turns.
Level_8.Narrative: A towering vortex slams down, trapping enemies in a roaring prison of force winds and charged air.

Level_9.Name: Conduction Field
Level_9.Effect: While active in combat, you radiate an electrical field. All enemies who end their turn within 2 spaces of you take 2 lightning damage.
Level_9.Narrative: The battlefield flickers with static. Sparks leap between your boots and nearby weapons - your presence becomes a hazard.

Level_10.Name: Tempest Ascension
Level_10.Effect: Once per long rest, ascend into a godlike storm form for 2 rounds: Gain Flight and become untargetable by ranged attacks; all of your attacks deal +3 lightning damage; you may teleport once per round within 5 spaces; enemies that begin their turn within 3 spaces must pass a Save or be pushed 2 spaces and take 4 lightning damage; activate Sky Wrath once during this state to strike any 3 targets anywhere on the battlefield with lightning for 7 damage each.
Level_10.Narrative: Your body surges with elemental wrath. Wind howls, the sky fractures with bolts, and for a moment, the battlefield belongs to the storm.
